content:
• Tuesday, February 6, 2018
  • BYD

    REI, JRVR, EVTC gain on SmallCap 600 entries

    • Boyd Gaming (NYSE:BYD) is moving to the S&P MidCap 400 to replace CalAtlantic Group (NYSE:CAA), set to be acquired by S&P 500 constituent Lennar around Feb. 12.
    • Taking Boyd's place in the SmallCap 600 is Ring Energy (NYSEMKT:REI), which is up 2.9% after hours. Those moves are effective before the open next Tuesday.
    • In other index moves, James River Group Holdings (NASDAQ:JRVR) is up 2.1% postmarket on word it's heading into the SmallCap 600 to replace Barracuda Networks (NYSE:CUDA) before the open on Monday; Barracuda is set to be acquired by P-E firm Thoma Bravo.
    • And EVERTEC (NYSE:EVTC) is up 1.6% in late trading as it's heading into the SmallCap 600 to replace Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SCMP), set to be acquired by S&P 500 constituent Mallinckrodt. That move is effective prior to the open on Feb. 14.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 PM
  • NTGR

    Netgear to spin off Arlo camera business; shares +3.1%

    • Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR) has risen 3.1% after hours following Q4 earnings where revenues grew nearly 8% and it made a major announcement on its camera business.
    • It announced it's spinning its successful Arlo business off into a separately traded company, with 20% expected public float and the rest held by Netgear for tax-free distribution to its shareholders.
    • Both Arlo and the rest of Netgear are successful, says CEO Patrick Lo, but "we believe that now is an opportune time for them to part ways and pursue different growth trajectories. Arlo will aggressively acquire new users, while Netgear will continue to deepen engagement with its vast installed base."
    • The company swung to a loss on a GAAP basis after taking a one-time charge of $48.3M related to tax reform. Non-GAAP EPS fell to $0.71 from the prior-year $0.88, but still beat an expected $0.64.
    • Revenue by segment: Arlo, $128.5M (up 67%); Connected Home, $198.7M (down 7.6%); SMB, $69.8M (down 8.1%).
    • For fiscal Q1, it's forecasting revenue of $330M-$345M, and non-GAAP operating margin of 6.5%-7.5%.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • DIS

    Disney's ESPN streaming coming with new app, $4.99/month price

    • On an earnings call following a mixed Q1 report for Disney (NYSE:DIS), CEO Bob Iger says the company's upcoming sports streaming service from ESPN will cost $4.99/month.
    • It will come with a heavily redesigned app, a "one-app approach," and as planned will feature sports events not available on linear ESPN channels.
    • Shares are now up 1.7% after hours.
    • The new app's "technological guts" will be "completely redone," Iger says, and will focus on three major offerings, Iger says: 1) tons of scores and highlights and news stories about sports, highly personalized; 2) "live streaming of the networks themselves" on an authenticated basis, a la the current Watch ESPN app, "ESPN, ESPN2, ESPNU etc."; 3) ESPN Plus, with "incremental thousands of hours" of programming, including the 30 for 30 library and content made only for the app.
    • Meanwhile, Disney's coming branded app will have less content than Netflix because its content will be more appealing overall, Iger says.
    • While television subs were down Y/Y again (by 3%), "We did see a modest sequential improvement in Q1, for the second straight quarter ... driven by adoption of MVPD digital platforms," says CFO Christine McCarthy.
    • In parks, Two Toy Story lands are coming, one in late April in Shanghai and another in Orlando at "some point later this year." They're not as large as Cars land but "large enough," Iger says. Another Toy Story film is coming in 2019.
    • Disney's effective tax rate with the new law was -19.4%, vs. a prior-year 33.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 78 Comments
  • MTCH

    Match Group reports Q4 beat, upside Q1 guidance

    • Match Group (NASDAQ:MTCH) shares are up 0.7% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat revenue estimates.
    • Upside Q1 guidance: Revenue, $380M to $390M (consensus: $365.03M); EBITDA, $115M to $120M. 
    • In-line FY18 guidance: Revenue, $1.5B to $1.6B ($1.55B); EBITDA, $550M to $600M. 
    • Key metrics: Direct revenue, $364M (+29%); Subscribers, 7M (+24%); ARPU, $0.55 (+4%); Tinder average subscribers, over 3M (+544K Q/Q); operating income, $128M (+13%); Adjusted EBITDA, $153M (+20%); operating cash flow, $321M (+24%); FCF, $292M (+37%); operating costs and expenses, $251.2M (+38%, 66% of revenue).
    • Drivers for 2018: Subscriber and revenue growth driven by Tinder with stability across rest of portfolio and ARPU. Margin expansion will be driven by Tinder operating leverage with continued discipline on marketing spend for other brands.   
    • Tinder goals for 2018: Drive engagement with a focus on the female experience and introduce new revenue features in 2H. 
    • Earnings call scheduled for tomorrow morning at 8:30 AM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Earnings release and presentation available here.    
    • Previously: Match Group EPS of $0.18 (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 13 Comments
  • OLN

    Olin beats by $2.45, beats on revenue

    • Olin (NYSE:OLN): Q4 EPS of $2.89 beats by $2.45.
    • Revenue of $1.62B (+16.5% Y/Y) beats by $80M.
    • Shares +1.5% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 8 Comments
  • PAYC

    Paycom Software reports Q4 beats, in-line guidance

    • Paycom Software (NYSE:PAYC) shares up a slight 0.1% after reporting Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • In-line Q1 guidance: Revenue, $150M to $152M (consensus: $150.02M); Adjusted EBITDA, $74M to $76M. 
    • In-line FY18 guidance: Revenue, $541M to $543M (consensus: $542.63M); Adjusted EBITDA, $213M to $215M. 
    • Key metrics: Recurring revenue, $111.7M (+29%); Adjusted EBITDA, $31.8M; cash and equivalents, $46.1M; total debt, $35.3M. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Paycom beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • HK

    Halcon Resources buys south Texas acreage for $381M, launches offering

    • Halcon Resources (NYSE:HK) -8.8% after-hours following news that it has recently acquired or agrees to acquire 22.6K net acres in Ward County, Tex., for $381M.
    • HK says the properties currently produce 1,325 boe/day, which equates to a purchase price of $14,674/acre.
    • To help fund the deal, HK launches a public offering of 8M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.2M shares.
    • Hk also estimates Q4 production was 6,300 boe/day, below company guidance due to fewer wells put online in November and early December than previously forecast; it continues to expect FY 2018 production of 15K-19K boe/day, excluding the impact of the West Quito Draw acquisition.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 9 Comments
  • PERY

    Perry Ellis spikes on go-private talk

    • Perry Ellis (NASDAQ:PERY) jumps 6% in AH trading on reports that Fortress and George Feldenkreis (ex-Perry Eliis executive chairman) will make a bid of $27.50 to take the retailer private.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 3 Comments
  • TCS

    The Container Store slips after soft guidance

    • Shares of The Container Store (NYSE:TCS) are on watch after the retailer misses Q4 estimates slightly and issues guidance behind consensus.
    • The company expects full-year revenue of $850M to $860M vs. $858M consensus and $845M to $865M pior guidance. Comparable sales are seen rising 0% to 1% vs. -1% to +1% prior range. Full-year EPS of $0.31 to $0.37 is anticipated vs. $0.37 consensus and $0.30 to $0.41 prior view.
    • CEO update: "In the fiscal third quarter we made further progress with our core Custom Closets offering and delivered continued improvement in all of our non-closet categories, with the exception of our holiday departments, which typically represent a small percentage of our annual sales, but historically have had a notable impact on our fiscal third quarter sales."
    • TCS -4.21% AH to $4.55.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCHP

    Microchip -5.7% after Q3 beats, mixed guidance

    • Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP) shares are down 5.7% aftermarket following Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates but included mixed guidance.
    • Q4 guidance: revenue, $964.4B to $1.004B (consensus: $1.01B); EPS, $1.30 to $1.39 (consensus: $1.37); gross margin, 61.3% to 61.7%; operating expenses, 22% to 22.4%; operating margin, 38.9% to 39.7%. 
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP gross margins, 61.4%; operating income, $391.7M; cash flow from operations, $365M; operating expenses, $361.8M. 
    • Tax impact: Company expects to pay $300M over eight years as part of the U.S. tax reform. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Microchip Technology beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences Q4 top line off 18%; non-GAAP earnings down 35%; shares off 1% after hours

    • Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD) Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 5,949 (-17.6%); product sales: 5,837 (-19.1%); antivirals: 5,213 (-21.0%).
    • Net loss: (3,865) (-224.4%); non-GAAP net income: 2,343 (-34.6%); loss/share: (2.96) (-225.4%); non-GAAP EPS: 1.78 (-34.1%).
    • Key product sales: Genvoya: 1,060 (+88.3%); Truvada: 797 (-8.2%); Harvoni: 644 (-60.7%); Epclusa: 565 (-46.1%); Atripla: 440 (-27.5%); Descovy: 365 (+145.0%); Odefsey: 325 (+109.7%).
    • GAAP loss includes $5.5B charge related to Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.
    • 2018 guidance: Total sales: $20B -21B.
    • Shares are down 1% after hours on robust volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 81 Comments
  • EXTR

    Extreme Networks +2.2% as margins expand, profits beat in Q2

    • Extreme Networks (NASDAQ:EXTR) is up 2.2% after hours following Q2 earnings where profits beat consensus but the company missed on the top line.
    • Revenues jumped nearly 50%, however, with gains in products and services.
    • Gross margin rose 490 basis points on a GAAP basis, to 55.8%; 59.4% non-GAAP. Operating margin was -13.5% on a GAAP basis, and 8.8% on a non-GAAP basis.
    • Net income fell to $16.4M from $17.1M.
    • "I am especially pleased with our non-GAAP gross margin performance in the quarter, which is close to exceeding our near-term goal of 60%," said CEO Ed Meyercord. "We turned away a significant volume of low-margin business this quarter in favor of higher quality, solutions-driven sales that drove our non-GAAP gross margin improvement for the 12th consecutive quarter."
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $174.8M (up 48%); Service, $56.3M (up 47%).
    • For Q3, it's targeting revenue of $262M-$272M, above consensus for $259.6M; non-GAAP gross margin of 58.9%-61.1%; opex of $130M-$133M; and EPS of $0.17-$0.24, vs. consensus for $0.19.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai Technologies +5.3% after Q4 beats

    • Akamai Technologies (NASDAQ:AKAM) shares are up 5.3% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. Guidance will come on the earnings call, which starts at 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Revenue breakdown (by division): Web Division, $355M (+17% Y/Y); Media Division, $284M (-3%); Enterprise and Carrier Division, $24M (+24%). 
    • Revenue breakdown (by solution category): Performance and Security Solutions, $416M (+13%) with Cloud Security Solutions representing $135M (+32%); Media Delivery Solutions, $190M (-3%); Service and Support Solutions, $57M (+9%). 
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP income from operations, $155M (-11%); operating margin, 23% (-5 percentage points); cash flow from operations, $197M; operating expenses, $635.5M; cash and equivalents, $1.3B. 
    • Restructuring charge: A $52M restructuring charge was recorded in Q4 primarily including workforce reductions and facility closures.  
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Akamai beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • SNAP

    Snap leaps 27% after user metrics, financials beat in Q4

    • Snap (NYSE:SNAP) is blowing up postmarket, rising 26.9%, after a Q4 earnings report where it posted a better-than-expected loss and exceeded revenue consensus with 72% Y/Y growth.
    • Net loss widened to just under $350M, and EBITDA fell to -$158.9M from $152.3M (but beat an expected -$186.8M).
    • But revenues of $285.7M easily cleared the Street's bar.
    • User growth also topped expectations, with daily active users up 5% from the previous quarter, adding 8.9M users to reach 187M; that's 18% Y/Y growth.
    • Average revenue per user rose 46% Y/Y and 31% from Q3 to $1.53; cost of revenue per user rose 5% Y/Y and fell 14% sequentially, to $1.02.
    • Cash, equivalents and marketable securities came to $2.04B by year-end; free cash flow for Q4 was -$197.3M vs. a prior-year -$188.1M.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 113 Comments
  • CMG

    Chipotle up after showing margin improvement

    • Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) reports comparable sales increased 0.9% in Q4 to edge pastthe +0.7% consensus estimate.
    • Restaurant-level operating margin rose 140 bps to 14.9% of sales.
    • Labor costs were level at 27.5% of sales.
    • Food/beverage/packaging costs as a percentage of sales fell 110 bps to 34.2%.
    • G&A expenses were down 90 bps to 5.2% of sales.
    • Chipotle says it anticipates comparable restaurant sales will increase at a low single-digit rate in 2018. The company expects to open 130 to 150 restaurants this year.
    • CEU update: "Our focus this year will be to continue perfecting the dining experience, enhancing the guest experience through innovations in digital and catering, and reinvesting in our restaurants. We are making good progress on our search for a new CEO who can improve execution, drive sales and enable Chipotle to realize our enormous potential."
    • Previously: Chipotle Mexican Grill beats by $0.02, revenue in-line (Feb. 6)
    • CMG +1.59% AH to $309.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 55 Comments

  • AKAM

    Akamai beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $663.45M (+7.7% Y/Y) beats by $14.4M.

  • MOH

    Molina down 6% on perceived risk to South Florida business

    • Molina Healthcare (MOH -5.9%) will finish the session in the red. Shares are down on 70% higher volume in apparent reaction to its disclosure that the Florida Agency for Health Care Administration (AHCA) notified it that has been chosen as a candidate to negotiate the 2019 managed care contract for Region 11 of the state's Medicaid program, a contract Molina now holds (valid through year-end 2018) that contributes ~8% of the company's revenues.
    • Molina says it is seeking to understand the basis for AHCA's preliminary selection of candidates so it may protect its rights and the continuity of care for its members.
    • Investors perceive heightened risk that a competitor could underbid it and capture the business next year or force it to cut its premiums.
    • Piper analyst Sarah James says the situation is "surprising" since it did not mention an invitation to negotiate in the other seven Florida counties that it services, adding that the company will probably fight to have the decision overturned.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • NOV

    National Oilwell Varco +4% as equipment orders rise to two year highs

    • National Oilwell Varco (NOV +4.3%) sprints out to a ~4% gain despite reporting in-line Q4 results, as it says oilfield equipment orders rose to their highest in more than two years amid increased U.S. drilling activity.
    • "It feels to us that the market is nearing an inflection point," CEO Clay Williams said during today's earnings conference call, as orders in NOV's rig division as well as for completions and productions posted strong gains during the quarter.
    • The company plans its first "meaningful" bonus compensation in three years, executives said, which likely will lower its free cash flow in the current quarter.
    • NOV said it remained cautious on the near-term prospects for an offshore equipment and services recovery, as producers remain focused on onshore activities which require lower crude prices to turn a profit.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Comedian Carrey urges selling Facebook over Russian interference

    • Jim Carrey is getting out of Facebook stock (FB +1.8%), and he wants you to, too.
    • "I’m dumping my @facebook stock and deleting my page because @facebook profited from Russian interference in our elections and they’re still not doing enough to stop it," the comedian tweeted this afternoon. "I encourage all other investors who care about our future to do the same. #unfriendfacebook"
    • Facebook admitted up to 126M users saw Russian-bought ads designed to interfere in the 2016 election.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 151 Comments
  • GBTC

    Bitcoin rallies alongside stocks

    • Is Bitcoin just another risk asset now. Alongside a sizable bounce in stocks, the crypto has also pushed aside the panicky action of the past couple of sessions, currently higher by nearly 11% to $7,691.
    • Also helping was Congressional testimony by the SEC and CFTC heads, in which the two didn't seem to be in a hurry to put the regulatory screws to the market. CFTC Chairman Giancarlo: "We owe it this new generation to respect their enthusiasm about virtual currencies with a thoughtful and balanced response, not a dismissive one.”
    • OTCQX:GBTC +18.1%
    • Previously: SEC's Clayton: ICOs need to be regulated like securities offerings (Feb. 6)
    • Previously: Crypto exodus: Bitcoin falls below $6,000 (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 22 Comments
  • MSFT

    Microsoft's free offer for Google, Box customers

    • Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) offers OneDrive for Business for free to customers with existing contracts with the competition.
    • Corporate customers using enterprise suites from Google (GOOG, GOOGL), Box (NYSE:BOX), and Dropbox (DROPB) can switch to OneDrive with no bill until the existing contract is paid off (max of three years). 
    • The Microsoft FastTrack team will work with new customers to migrate to OneDrive and Office 365. 
    • Offer not valid for current customers and businesses have to commit to a minimum of 400 users.   
    • Businesses can sign up for the deal through June 30. 
    • Microsoft shares are up 2.8%.   
    • Box shares are down 0.4%.
    • Previously: Argus raises Microsoft target to 22% upside (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 17 Comments

  • Stocks rise sharply in late action

    • A very choppy day has resolved to the upside, with the Dow (DIA +1.5%), S&P 500 (SPY +1.3%), Nasdaq (QQQ +1.8%), and Russell 2000 (IWM +1%) all sporting 1%+ gains 40 minutes before the close.
    • All S&P sectors are in the green, except utilities, down 1.75% as the 10-year yield surges 7 basis points to 2.78%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 28 Comments
  • SNE

    Sony Pictures removes three presidents to flatten structure

    • Sony (SNE +4%) is shaking up ranks at its entertainment unit as part of an ongoing effort to streamline management, raising new questions about whether the company would consider selling its media operations.
    • Three president-level execs are let go: international channels chief Andy Kaplan, chief TV marketing officer Sheraton Kalouria and home entertainment head Man Jit Singh.
    • Sony Pictures TV Chairman Mike Hopkins will oversee international channels, while Sony Pictures TV President of Distribution Keith Le Goy will take on home entertainment and have a dual report to Hopkins and Sony Motion Picture Group Chairman Tom Rothman.
    • SPE Chairman/CEO Tony Vinciquerra, installed on top of the entertainment group last spring, has looked to reduce what he thinks is a top-heavy studio.
    • The moves follow last week's news that Sony CEO Kazuo Hirai would move on to the chairman's role, replaced by current Sony CFO Kenichiro Yoshida.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • NBY

    NovaBay raises almost $6M via private placement of shares at $3.52; shares up 7%

    • NovaBay Pharmaceuticals (NBY +6.5%) reports that it has inked an agreement with a Hong Kong investor for the sale of 1.7M shares of common stock at $3.52 per share for a total of $5,984,000.
    • The company had an amended share purchase agreement in place with Beijing-based Ch-Gemstone under which it agreed to buy 2.4M shares for a total of $10.32M (average of $4.30/share) but it was terminated on the January 31 deadline after Ch-Gemstone failed to secure Chinese regulatory approval for the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • ET

    Energy Transfer's Rover gas pipeline gets OK to drill under Ohio river

    • The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission authorizes Energy Transfer Partners (ETP +3.3%) to resume horizontal drilling under the Tuscarawas River in Ohio for the Rover natural gas pipeline.
    • FERC says it allowed Rover to start drilling again after ETP provided a revised drilling plan for the second pipe under the river and analysis of residential water wells in the vicinity of the drill.
    • ETP already has one pipe in service under the Tuscarawas with more than 1.1B cf/day of gas flowing through it, but the FERC ordered Rover to stop drilling of the second pipe under the river on Jan. 24 after some drilling fluid was lost.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 108 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple could offer battery rebates, software update coming to newer iPhones

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) sees a “strong demand” for replacement iPhone batteries and could offer rebates to some customers who paid full price for the replacement.
    • The company’s statement comes in a letter Apple sent to U.S. Senate Chairman June Thune last week, which was made public today, following December’s acknowledgment that a software update throttled iPhones with older batteries. 
    • Apple previously announced a discount program that took replacement batteries down $50 to $29.  
    • The same letter says Apple will roll out a software update for last year’s models (iPhone 8/8 Plus and X) since the throttling features added to those phones aren’t necessary due to hardware updates. 
    • The newer phones weren’t originally included in the software update plans. 
    • Apple shares are up 3%.    
    • Previously: Apple roundup: Watch sales up in FY17, second Chinese center, EU investigating Shazam acquisition (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 25 Comments
  • LNAGF

    Linde expects more asset sales than planned to clear Praxair merger

    • Linde (OTCPK:LNAGF, LNEGY) says it expects it will need to make more divestments than initially planned to win antitrust approval for its merger with Praxair (PX +3.1%).
    • But Linde says it would not have to sell businesses with revenues and earnings that exceeded the thresholds agreed with the U.S. company; if regulators demanded the disposal of businesses with more than $3.7B in sales or $1.1B in EBITDA, either party could withdraw without penalty.
    • The statement from Linde comes as the company prepares to send information packages on antitrust-related assets to prospective buyers in coming days, Reuters reports.
    • The assets up for sale are expected to be worth a combined €6.5B-€7.5B, with most located in the U.S. and Europe.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • OCLR

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (2/6/18)

    • Gainers: OCLR +22%. LITE +20%. DPW +13%. TRIP +13%. NPTN +12%.
    • Losers: INPX -41%. NQ -21%. MARK -19%. OHGI -16%. EMKR -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • MARK

    Remark responds to "bogus claims" in "sloppy" short report

    • Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) tweets a response to the report from short seller J Capital.  
    • ”As it relates to the sloppy short driven report released by J Capital, we will issue a proper response to these bogus claims.”
    • And another tweet: “Note that this same analyst also questioned Alibaba’s financials – and the stock has soared since.”
    • The tweets continue with Remark displaying an award from Alibaba Cloud and noting that the company presented at the World Internet Conference alongside the likes of Google and Apple. 
    • Remark Holdings shares are down 14.4%.  
    • Previously: J Capital: Remark "Most Brazen Stock Promote"; shares -23.5% (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 40 Comments
  • XIV

    XIV reopens for trade, falls 94%

    • The VelocityShares Daily Inverse VIX Short-Term ETN (NASDAQ:XIV) reopened for trade a few minutes back. It's under volatility halt at the moment, but down 93.9% from last night's closet to $6.15. At least a few who for years picked up pennies in front of a steamroller, just got rolled.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 29 Comments
  • FDX

    FedEx and UPS fall after report of Amazon delivery push

    • Fed (FDX -1.7%) and UPS (UPS -2.4%) are tracking lower after Capital Forum reports that Amazon (AMZN +1%) is considering a stronger move into parcel delivery.
    • Amazon is reportedly asking shipping platforms to add it as an option alongside USPS, FedEx and UPS before the end of this year (per Bloomberg).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 69 Comments
  • CGG-OLD

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (2/6/2018)

    • Gainers: CGG-OLD +14%. WMLP-OLD +12%. LEU +7%. REI +7%.
    • Losers: NOG -10%. GBR -9%. UPL -7%. SN -7%. CELP -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 6 Comments
  • LMFA

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (02/06/2018)

    • Gainers: LMFA +8%. VIRT +6%.RE +6%.
    • Losers: CBOE -11%. OPHC -8%. AMRK -7%. WHLR -6%. OPY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • TEUM

    Pareteum offers new whitepaper on blockchain approach; shares rising

    • Pareteum (NYSEMKT:TEUM) is taking another opportunity to lay out its approach to blockchain technology, and shares are on the rise again, up 9.5% today against an up-and-down market.
    • A new whitepaper from the company lays out use cases for blockchain tech including security, identity management and settlement.
    • Alongside, Chief Technology Officer Ali Davachi says "The TEUM Blockchain (TBC) will revolutionize how our customers leverage Blockchain technology. Enabling our SaaS platform with identity management, transaction settlements and payment solutions greatly expands the opportunity for our customers."

  • AAPL

    Apple roundup: Watch sales up in FY17, second Chinese center, EU investigating Shazam acquisition

    • The Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) Watch shipped 18M units in 2017, up 54% on the year, according to Canalys data.
    • Shipments were 8M in the holiday season, up 32% on 4Q16. 
    • The cellular version of the Series 3 helped drive the growth but only accounted for about 13% of the total. The non-LTE Series 3 accounted for 35% and the older Series 1 and Series 2 combined for a quarter of the total.
    • Data center: On Saturday, reports said that Apple plans to open its first China data center in 2020. Now it looks like Apple will have two centers operable by that date. 
    • The official Xinhua news agency, citing local government, says the second center will be built in the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region in the north.   
    • Shazam investigation: The European Commission announces plans to assess Apple’s acquisition of Shazam. 
    • Australia, France, Iceland, Italy, Norway, Spain, and Sweden joined together to request the investigation. 
    • Key quote: “Apple's proposed acquisition of Shazam does not meet the turnover thresholds set by the EU Merger Regulation for mergers that must be notified to the European Commission because they have an EU dimension. It was notified by Apple for regulatory clearance in Austria, where the transaction meets the national merger notification threshold." 
    • Apple shares are up 2.1%.      
    • Previously: Report: Apple's first China data center eyes 2020 opening (Feb. 3)

  • CS

    Credit Suisse liquidating XIV Feb. 20

    • Credit Suisse (CS -1.6%) will end trading in its inverse volatility ETN, the VelocityShares Daily Inverse VIX Short-Term (NASDAQ:XIV), after an 84% collapse that halted trading in the notes.
    • The last day of trading for the security is Feb. 20, the bank says.
    • It was intended to track calm markets by giving the opposite return of the VIX volatility index, but broke down along with similar instruments as volatility blew up late yesterday.
    • CS made the move since the intraday indicative value off XIV was 20% or less of the prior day's closing indicative value, which created an acceleration event.
    • The decline has no "material impact" on the bank itself, Credit Suisse said last night; CS shares have opened lower along with the broader market.
